title: Chongqing Municipal Government provides donation of 3,700 sets of medical protective clothing and 300 infrared thermometers in June 2020
description: On June 9, 2020, the Chongqing Municipal Government provided a donation of 3,700 sets of medical protective clothing and 300 infrared forehead thermometers to the Government of Uruguay to be used to combat the COVID - 19 pandemic. Harvard's Mask Diplomacy dataset estimates the donation was worth USD 60,000.  272 of the thermometers were distributed to the National Administration of Public Education.  Chongqing and the San Jose Province in Uruguay have had a sister city agreement since 2018. This donation to the Uruguayan Government follows a donation from Uruguay to Chongqing earlier in the pandemic, a donation by the city's CCPIT branch to the Uruguayan MFA in April (captured via project #91548), and a donation by a group of public and private organizations in Chongqing in May 2020 to San Jose (captured via project #68935).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chongqing Municipal Government provides donation of 3,700 sets of medical protective clothing and 300 infrared thermometers in June 2020

# Description
On June 9, 2020, the Chongqing Municipal Government provided a donation of 3,700 sets of medical protective clothing and 300 infrared forehead thermometers to the Government of Uruguay to be used to combat the COVID - 19 pandemic. Harvard's Mask Diplomacy dataset estimates the donation was worth USD 60,000.  272 of the thermometers were distributed to the National Administration of Public Education.  Chongqing and the San Jose Province in Uruguay have had a sister city agreement since 2018. This donation to the Uruguayan Government follows a donation from Uruguay to Chongqing earlier in the pandemic, a donation by the city's CCPIT branch to the Uruguayan MFA in April (captured via project #91548), and a donation by a group of public and private organizations in Chongqing in May 2020 to San Jose (captured via project #68935).
justification: Project involves donation of medical equipment for pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical protective clothing and infrared thermometers for COVID-19 response

title: Chinese government donates 32,000 masks to Uruguayan National Sports Secretariat in May 2020
description: On the week of May 11 through May 17, a donation of at least 32,000 masks was handed over to the Uruguayan Ministry of Foreign Affairs from the Chinese government.   Then, on May 19, 2020, officials from the Uruguayan Foreign Ministry, Undersecretary Carolina Ache and General Director of International Cooperation Federico Perazza, met with representatives from the Uruguayan National Sports Secretariat, including Mr. Sebastián Bauzá, to hand over 32,000 masks to the National Sports Secretariat. Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset estimated the value of the donation to be USD 12,800.  The pandemic protective wear will be given out to the public at 114 sports venues across Uruguay in order to mitigate the spread of COVID - 19. The National Children's Football Organization (ONFI) was to help the Sports Secretariat with the distribution as well.
staff_comments: 1. Because the Chinese government first handed this donation over to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, which subsequently provided it to the National Sports Secretariat, there is a meaningful chance these 32,000 masks were part of a larger donation to the national government writ large, and this portion was distributed to the Sports Secretariat. However, there is not sufficient evidence to link it to any particular donation, and there are no projects currently captured by AidData that satisfy all of the following: (1) Received by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (2) on the week prior to May 19, 2020 (3) that provided a donation of masks equivalent to or exceeding 32,000. Huawei's donation (captured via project #69049) comes close to satisfying these criteria, and photographs of the donation containers appear to match those given to the Sports Secretariat. However, the materials arrived in Uruguay on April 17, 2020, confirmed via photographs that match the interior of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building (see project #91466, for example). It is also possible that the donation was one of those provided first to one of Uruguay's diplomatic missions in China (the date typically reported publicly and captured by AidData as the project's end date) and later to Uruguay. However, there would be insufficient evidence to link this project to any individual project of that variety.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates 32,000 masks to Uruguayan National Sports Secretariat in May 2020

# Description
On the week of May 11 through May 17, a donation of at least 32,000 masks was handed over to the Uruguayan Ministry of Foreign Affairs from the Chinese government.   Then, on May 19, 2020, officials from the Uruguayan Foreign Ministry, Undersecretary Carolina Ache and General Director of International Cooperation Federico Perazza, met with representatives from the Uruguayan National Sports Secretariat, including Mr. Sebastián Bauzá, to hand over 32,000 masks to the National Sports Secretariat. Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset estimated the value of the donation to be USD 12,800.  The pandemic protective wear will be given out to the public at 114 sports venues across Uruguay in order to mitigate the spread of COVID - 19. The National Children's Football Organization (ONFI) was to help the Sports Secretariat with the distribution as well.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of 32,000 masks for COVID-19 protection, distributed through sports venues

title: Qingdao Municipal Government provides donation of 10,000 masks worth RMB 16,000 to Montevideo in December 2020
description: On June 8, 2020, the Montevideo Municipal Government passed a resolution accepting a donation of 10,000 masks from the Qingdao Municipal Government and approving the text of the agreement that had committed the donation. This agreement, signed on an unknown date, was signed by the Office of Foreign Affairs of the Municipal Government of Qingdao and representatives of the Government of Montevideo.  Then, on June 25, 2020, the Qingdao Municipal Government requested to amend the donation agreement. On July 13, 2020, Montevideo approved the updated text. On December 31, 2020, the handover ceremony took place for the materials.  According to the updated donation agreement, the donated materials had a total value of RMB 16,000 and were intended to help Montevideo combat COVID-19.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Qingdao Municipal Government provides donation of 10,000 masks worth RMB 16,000 to Montevideo in December 2020

# Description
On June 8, 2020, the Montevideo Municipal Government passed a resolution accepting a donation of 10,000 masks from the Qingdao Municipal Government and approving the text of the agreement that had committed the donation. This agreement, signed on an unknown date, was signed by the Office of Foreign Affairs of the Municipal Government of Qingdao and representatives of the Government of Montevideo.  Then, on June 25, 2020, the Qingdao Municipal Government requested to amend the donation agreement. On July 13, 2020, Montevideo approved the updated text. On December 31, 2020, the handover ceremony took place for the materials.  According to the updated donation agreement, the donated materials had a total value of RMB 16,000 and were intended to help Montevideo combat COVID-19.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 10,000 masks for COVID-19 relief, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region provides donation of 30,000 masks and 80 thermometers to Paysandu Province in Uruguay in April 2020
description: On April 3, 2020, the Government of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region began sending a donation of 30,000 masks and 80 thermometers to the Paysandú Province in Uruguay to help combat the COVID-19 pandemic. The donation was expected to take ten days to arrive. While the actual arrival date is unknown, by June 26, 2020, the donation was confirmed to be in Paysandú.  Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset estimated that the donation was worth about USD 12,320.  Guangxi and Paysandú have had a cooperative relationship since October 25, 2019, and in February 2020, Paysandú sent a donation of masks to fight COVID-19 to Guangxi.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region provides donation of 30,000 masks and 80 thermometers to Paysandu Province in Uruguay in April 2020

# Description
On April 3, 2020, the Government of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region began sending a donation of 30,000 masks and 80 thermometers to the Paysandú Province in Uruguay to help combat the COVID-19 pandemic. The donation was expected to take ten days to arrive. While the actual arrival date is unknown, by June 26, 2020, the donation was confirmed to be in Paysandú.  Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset estimated that the donation was worth about USD 12,320.  Guangxi and Paysandú have had a cooperative relationship since October 25, 2019, and in February 2020, Paysandú sent a donation of masks to fight COVID-19 to Guangxi.
justification: Project is focused on public health support during COVID-19 pandemic, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of medical supplies (masks and thermometers) for pandemic response

title: SDIC Trading provides donation of 10,000 medical surgical masks and 500 pairs of protective glasses to Government of Uruguay in April 2020
description: On April 7, 2020, the SDIC Trading Company provided a donation of 10,000 medical surgical masks and 500 pairs of protective glasses to the Government of Uruguay, handing over the materials to the Uruguayan Ambassador in China. The donation is intended to assist Uruguay in combatting COVID-19. According to the Chinese Embassy in Uruguay, the donation will be delivered to Uruguay by air on April 8, 2020.
staff_comments: 1. SDIC Trading Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of State Development & Investment Corporation (SDIC).AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Hainan province provides donation of 9,600 masks to Uruguay's Rocha Department in April 2020
description: On or about April 8, 2020, the Hainan Province committed a donation of 9,600 masks to their sister provincial government in Rocha, Uruguay, in order to combat COVID-19. By April 8, 2020, the donation had been handed over to the Uruguayan Embassy in China. By July 15, 2020, the donation had arrived in Rocha. However, the exact arrival date is unknown.  The masks were to be distributed to various agencies in the provincial government and municipal governments within the province by Rocha's Coordinating Center for Departmental Emergencies (Centro Coordinador de Emergencias Departamentales, CECOED).  Using the value of the masks provided by Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset, the donation was worth approximately USD 3,840.
staff_comments: 1. While one Tweet from the Government of Rocha says the donation included 10,000 masks, both the government website and the Chinese Embassy report the donation included 9,600 masks. The more precise number, which is supported by multiple official sources, has been used.2. Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset uses the 10,000 masks number, and estimates the value of 10,000 masks as 4,000 USD, indicating the estimated value of an individual mask is 0.4 USD. This number is used (9,600 x 0.4) to approximate the value of the donation.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Hainan province provides donation of 9,600 masks to Uruguay's Rocha Department in April 2020

# Description
On or about April 8, 2020, the Hainan Province committed a donation of 9,600 masks to their sister provincial government in Rocha, Uruguay, in order to combat COVID-19. By April 8, 2020, the donation had been handed over to the Uruguayan Embassy in China. By July 15, 2020, the donation had arrived in Rocha. However, the exact arrival date is unknown.  The masks were to be distributed to various agencies in the provincial government and municipal governments within the province by Rocha's Coordinating Center for Departmental Emergencies (Centro Coordinador de Emergencias Departamentales, CECOED).  Using the value of the masks provided by Harvard's Mask Diplomacy Dataset, the donation was worth approximately USD 3,840.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of masks for COVID-19 relief, healthcare focus

title: Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. provides donation of 10,000 disposable masks to Uruguay in April 2020
description: On or about April 13, 2020, Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. handed over a donation of 10,000 disposable masks to the Uruguayan Embassy in China. The masks were subsequently handed over to the Government of Uruguay and distributed to various institutions to help combat COVID-19, including the National Emergency System (SINAE). According to reporting from El País, 5,000 of the masks were destined to go to rural schools. The date that the masks arrived in Uruguay is unknown.   Harvard's Mask Diplomacy dataset estimates the donation had a value of USD 4,000.  This was a part of a larger donation that Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. of 700,000 pieces of various medical supplies to 20 countries that was started in late February.
staff_comments: 1. The commitment date is based off of a report that said Chery's donations were announced in late February 2020. (see: Source ID# 169100)
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. provides donation of 10,000 disposable masks to Uruguay in April 2020

# Description
On or about April 13, 2020, Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. handed over a donation of 10,000 disposable masks to the Uruguayan Embassy in China. The masks were subsequently handed over to the Government of Uruguay and distributed to various institutions to help combat COVID-19, including the National Emergency System (SINAE). According to reporting from El País, 5,000 of the masks were destined to go to rural schools. The date that the masks arrived in Uruguay is unknown.   Harvard's Mask Diplomacy dataset estimates the donation had a value of USD 4,000.  This was a part of a larger donation that Chery Automobile Co. Ltd. of 700,000 pieces of various medical supplies to 20 countries that was started in late February.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Donation of 10,000 disposable masks for COVID-19 relief, distributed to government institutions and rural schools

Harvard's Mask Diplomacy dataset estimated the donation's value to be about USD 3,200.

title: Shenyang Municipal Government donates 10,000 face masks and 100 goggles to Florida in May - August 2020
description: On May 12, 2020, the Municipality of Florida in Uruguay received a donation of 1,000 masks from the Shenyang Municipal Government, with the commitment that an additional 9,000 masks and other supplies would arrive at a later date. Fernando Lugris, the Uruguayan Ambassador to China, helped facilitate the donation.  Then, on August 24, 2020, the Office of the Mayor of Florida, received 9,000 face masks and 100 special protective glasses.   Shenyang and Florida have had a sister city agreement since 2017.
staff_comments: The article regarding a donation to Florida from 'Ganzou' has not been 1. There is no Chinese province of Ganzou. Searches in Chinese and Spanish for any similarly-Romanized province in case of a mistranslation does not yield results: Guizhou, Guangzhou, or Gansu. Similarly, the city of Ganzhou does not yield results. There are no sub-divisions of Shenyang called Ganzou, either.2. 9 million masks would be an unusually large donation for an individual donor, let alone a provincial government or municipal government. It is likely a typo and is the follow up 9,000 masks 'and more' promised by the articles about the masks handed over in May 2020.3. This project has not been picked up by the Wilson Center, Harvard, or UC Chile's mask diplomacy datasets. AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Shenyang Municipal Government donates 10,000 face masks and 100 goggles to Florida in May - August 2020

# Description
On May 12, 2020, the Municipality of Florida in Uruguay received a donation of 1,000 masks from the Shenyang Municipal Government, with the commitment that an additional 9,000 masks and other supplies would arrive at a later date. Fernando Lugris, the Uruguayan Ambassador to China, helped facilitate the donation.  Then, on August 24, 2020, the Office of the Mayor of Florida, received 9,000 face masks and 100 special protective glasses.   Shenyang and Florida have had a sister city agreement since 2017.
justification: Project is a donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of face masks and goggles, healthcare-related supplies

title: Chinese government donates electronic equipment to Uruguay's National Customs Directorate
description: On October, 21, 2020, the Chinese government handed over a donation of furniture and electronics to Uruguay's National Customs Directorate (DNA). The donation included 6 webcams with microphone, 10 Go Pro cameras, and 2 night vision binoculars, among other items.
combined_text:

TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

On October, 21, 2020, the Chinese government handed over a donation of furniture and electronics to Uruguay's National Customs Directorate (DNA). The donation included 6 webcams with microphone, 10 Go Pro cameras, and 2 night vision binoculars, among other items.
